subject: Receipt for subscription payment Feb 26, 2025
htmlContent:
Thank you for your payment! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Thank you for your payment!

We have successfully processed payment for your recurring Professional team (monthly) subscription to Figma, and you may find your receipt here. If you believe this charge to be in error or have any questions, please email support@figma.com.

Invoice ID: in_1QwqQZIvcqWR3dFDBs6mYwVp
Team: Common Tools
Start: Feb 26, 2025
End: Mar 26, 2025
Figma Design seats: 1
FigJam seats: 0
Total: $15.00 USD

You can manage your bill by visiting the Admin settings.

You can cancel your subscription at any time by clicking 'Cancel plan' from Settings tab of the team. If you cancel your subscription, Figma will downgrade your team to a free Starter team and you will lose access to Professional plan features at the end of your billing period.

If you have an annual plan, you will be notified 30 days before your annual plan is set to renew. At that time, you can change the number of full seats on your plan for the next year. Otherwise, the plan will renew with the same number of full seats again.

Your Figma subscription is governed by our Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, and our Cancellation Policy.

Figma is a design platform for teams who build products together. Born on the Web, Figma helps the entire product team create, test, and ship better designs, faster.
760 Market Street, Floor 10
San Francisco, CA, 94102

snippet: Join AWS Innovate to transform your business with AI. AWS Logo Innovate Gen AI + Data Power your future with gen AI Online event Date March 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM PT How to
subject: Unlock gen AI breakthroughs with AWS
plainText:
Power your future with gen AI


Online event

Date

March 13, 2025
12:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET 
9:00 AM - 2:00 PM PT

How to attend
Event hosted virtually, register now to reserve your seat.

Register now › https://email.awscloud.com/MTEyLVRaTS03NjYAAAGY4ab3H5lGhlkxMWTiMnu7oqEt3iVg04AbniOC1pXMaHg0xKyKFVx6pV01cWKLSexrVlZMgrc=
------

Hear from these AWS Partners


OpsGuru
Ali Shiraz
Principal Architect

Quantiphi
Kanishk Mehta
Product Leader

Snorkel AI
Chris Borg
AI & Data Strategy Leader

Lightning AI
Robert Levy
Staff Software Engineer



Register now › https://email.awscloud.com/MTEyLVRaTS03NjYAAAGY4ab3H5lGhlkxMWTiMnu7oqEt3iVg04AbniOC1pXMaHg0xKyKFVx6pV01cWKLSexrVlZMgrc=

-----


Accelerate gen AI with AWS Partners

Join us at AWS Innovate to discover how Amazon Web Services (AWS) can help you harness the full potential of generative AI and data. Hear how AWS Partners are helping customers innovate faster and build a competitive advantage with gen AI. Learn about the tools and infrastructure needed to build and scale gen AI. Find out how to make your data AI-ready and create gen AI applications that drive real business value.

AWS Innovate › https://email.awscloud.com/MTEyLVRaTS03NjYAAAGY4ab3H36wKK5X6bWjaHXUd-Wqa0Xe05UI5WmZZ8-0Ko1oh_P4jQjLlSMi4y6jaeyNE2kdnKo=
-----

At AWS Innovate, you’ll learn how to:

- Securely build and scale gen AI with a comprehensive set of tools and infrastructure
- Build a strong data foundation to fuel gen AI innovation
- Use gen AI to enhance customer experiences, boost employee productivity, and drive process efficiencies



------

htmlContent:
Join AWS Innovate to transform your business with AI.
 
 
 
Power your future with gen AI
 
 
Online event
 
Date
 
March 13, 2025
12:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET
9:00 AM - 2:00 PM PT
How to attend
 
Event hosted virtually, register now to reserve your seat.
 
Hear from these AWS Partners
 
 
OpsGuru
 
Ali Shiraz
Principal Architect

 
 
Quantiphi
 
Kanishk Mehta
Product Leader
 
 
Snorkel AI
 
Chris Borg
AI & Data Strategy Leader
 
 
Lightning AI
 
Robert Levy
Staff Software Engineer

 
Register now
 
Accelerate gen AI with AWS Partners
 
Join us at AWS Innovate to discover how Amazon Web Services (AWS) can help you harness the full potential of generative AI and data. Hear how AWS Partners are helping customers innovate faster and build a competitive advantage with gen AI. Learn about the tools and infrastructure needed to build and scale gen AI. Find out how to make your data AI-ready and create gen AI applications that drive real business value.
 
 
At AWS Innovate, you’ll learn how to:
 
  • Securely build and scale gen AI with a comprehensive set of tools and infrastructure
  • Build a strong data foundation to fuel gen AI innovation
  • Use gen AI to enhance customer experiences, boost employee productivity, and drive process efficiencies

snippet: We're introducing GCE simplified API rate limits. MY CONSOLE Hello Jake, We're writing to inform you that the Google Compute Engine (GCE) API quota metrics will change by mid March 2025,
subject: [Action Advised] Review the new GCE API rate limits and update Cloud monitoring artifacts
plainText:
We're introducing GCE simplified API rate limits.




MY CONSOLE




Hello Jake,

We're writing to inform you that the Google Compute Engine (GCE) API quota  
metrics will change by mid March 2025, introducing new API rate limits  
grouped into four simple categories with higher default limits:


Global Reads
Global Writes
Regional Reads
Regional Writes

What you need to know

By mid March 2025, we are introducing new API rate limit quota metrics with  
higher limit values. This upcoming change is designed to simplify API rate  
limit quota metric discoverability and manageability, with default quota  
values that exceed typical usage.

For projects expected to exceed the default values of the new quota  
metrics, we will automatically increase the quotas. This ensures a smooth  
transition.

What this means for you


The new categories make it easier to understand and manage your API usage  
and offer higher default quota limits.
All API usage will be charged against both new and existing quota metrics.
Quota charged against the new API rate limit will use weighted charging  
based on query complexity.
If your usage exceeds the quota limits, your requests may be rejected with  
a rateLimitExceeded error.
Existing quota metrics and usage will remain in place for backwards  
compatibility with an increased default quota limit until further notice.
Cloud monitoring alerts, dashboards, and queries will continue to work as  
is without any disruption.

What you need to do

While no immediate action is required from you, we strongly recommend  
familiarizing yourself with the new API rate limit metrics to take full  
advantage of the changes.


Review the Documentation: Learn more about the simplified API quota metrics  
in our documentation: Simplified API quota metrics.
View your quota usage and requests for higher quota values to prevent  
service disruptions.
Use simplified quota metrics in your Cloud Monitoring artifacts (Optional):  
You can add the new metrics on your Cloud Monitoring artifacts (alerts,  
dashboards, and queries). You can find detailed instructions on Use  
simplified API quota metrics in Cloud Monitoring.

We're here to help

If you have any questions or need assistance, please contact Google Cloud  
Support.

Thank you for choosing Google Compute Engine.





—The Google Cloud Team





DOCUMENTATION



SUPPORT




Was this information helpful?

Yes Neutral No


© 2025 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you about  
important changes to Google Cloud Platform or your account.



Visit Google Cloud blog Visit GCP on GitHub Visit Google Cloud on LinkedIn  
Visit Google Cloud on Twitter
htmlContent:
We're introducing GCE simplified API rate limits.
MY CONSOLE
 

Hello Jake,

We’re writing to inform you that the Google Compute Engine (GCE) API quota metrics will change by mid March 2025, introducing new API rate limits grouped into four simple categories with higher default limits:

  • Global Reads
  • Global Writes
  • Regional Reads
  • Regional Writes

What you need to know

By mid March 2025, we are introducing new API rate limit quota metrics with higher limit values. This upcoming change is designed to simplify API rate limit quota metric discoverability and manageability, with default quota values that exceed typical usage.

For projects expected to exceed the default values of the new quota metrics, we will automatically increase the quotas. This ensures a smooth transition.

What this means for you

  • The new categories make it easier to understand and manage your API usage and offer higher default quota limits.
  • All API usage will be charged against both new and existing quota metrics.
  • Quota charged against the new API rate limit will use weighted charging based on query complexity.
  • If your usage exceeds the quota limits, your requests may be rejected with a rateLimitExceeded error.
  • Existing quota metrics and usage will remain in place for backwards compatibility with an increased default quota limit until further notice.
  • Cloud monitoring alerts, dashboards, and queries will continue to work as is without any disruption.

What you need to do

While no immediate action is required from you, we strongly recommend familiarizing yourself with the new API rate limit metrics to take full advantage of the changes.

  • Review the Documentation: Learn more about the simplified API quota metrics in our documentation: Simplified API quota metrics.
  • View your quota usage and requests for higher quota values to prevent service disruptions.
  • Use simplified quota metrics in your Cloud Monitoring artifacts (Optional): You can add the new metrics on your Cloud Monitoring artifacts (alerts, dashboards, and queries). You can find detailed instructions on Use simplified API quota metrics in Cloud Monitoring.

We're here to help

If you have any questions or need assistance, please contact Google Cloud Support.

Thank you for choosing Google Compute Engine.
—The Google Cloud Team
DOCUMENTATION
SUPPORT

Was this information helpful?

       

© 2025 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043
